channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Gaza cease-fire talks set to resume; Iran braces for Israeli retaliation
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: The upcoming talks in Qatar represent the latest effort by the United States to forge a cease-fire after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.

item.title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills three journalists, government says
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Andrew Jeong

item.title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills three journalists
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Adam Taylor, Andrew Jeong
item.description: The deaths came amid continued heavy fighting in southern Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah, with Israel announcing Friday that five soldiers were killed in combat.

item.title: Hezbollah proving a formidable foe against Israeli forces in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous, Steve Hendrix

item.title: Satellite images show major expansion at Russian site with secret bioweapons past
item.dc:creator: Joby Warrick, Jarrett Ley
item.description: New construction at a military research site near Moscow reveals a specialized laboratory complex designed to research and handle deadly pathogens, experts say.

item.title: Lies, intrigue, lawsuits: The last battle for a ‘cursed’ giant emerald
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: The Bahia Emerald, a minifridge-sized mass of black schist and green crystals, might be worth $1 billion. Brazil wants it back.

item.title: Israel, U.S. announce efforts to negotiate cease-fire and hostage deal
item.dc:creator: John Hudson

item.title: Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: People in northern Gaza running out of means to survive, U.N. says
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Hajar Harb, Claire Parker, John Hudson, Hazem Balousha

item.title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Hazem Balousha, Sammy Westfall

item.title: Is Israel carrying out de facto ethnic cleansing?
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A pro-settlement Israeli group and some Israeli lawmakers gathered a couple miles from northern Gaza’s blasted neighborhoods to rally around settling Gaza.

item.title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Hazem Balousha, Sammy Westfall
item.description: The Israeli military published documents that it said showed cooperation between Al Jazeera and Hamas. The network denied the allegations, saying Israel wanted to “silence” its journalists.

item.title: Why North Korea is sending soldiers to the Russian front lines
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.

item.title: People in northern Gaza running out of means to survive, U.N. says
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Hajar Harb, Claire Parker, John Hudson, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Israel’s military assault has pushed the area to the edge of humanitarian collapse, aid officials say, after a near-total blockade on aid deliveries to the north.

item.title: Putin does not deny presence of North Korean troops in Russia
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: The U.S. government said it had evidence that at least 3,000 North Korean soldiers were being trained in Russia.

item.title: Canada to cut immigration levels in major reversal, Trudeau says
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: The U-turn, on an approach that has set Canada apart from the United States, comes as public support for immigration wanes.

item.title: Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: U.S. announces plan to resume Gaza peace talks, send $135M in aid for Palestinians
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Annabelle Timsit, John Hudson, Bryan Pietsch, Sammy Westfall
item.description: U.S. and Israeli officials are set for talks in Doha on a cease-fire and hostage deal, the U.S. secretary of state said. He announced $135 million in aid for Palestinians.

item.title: Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Iran is bracing for a retaliatory attack by Israel, which analysts say will probably target military sites rather than nuclear or oil facilities.

item.title: Putin presents himself as champion of the developing world at summit
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: Russia was in the spotlight at the BRICS summit, but the organization of mostly developing nations is far from united behind Vladimir Putin’s agenda.

item.title: Israel, U.S. announce efforts to negotiate cease-fire and hostage deal
item.dc:creator: John Hudson

item.title: Hezbollah proving a formidable foe against Israeli forces in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous, Steve Hendrix
item.description: The militant group has bounced back from major setbacks thanks to a flexible command structure, help from Iran and years of planning for an Israeli invasion.

item.title: North Gaza faces ‘extraordinary challenges,’ Blinken says, as conditions worsen
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Annabelle Timsit, Steve Hendrix, Hajar Harb

item.title: 36-year-old surfer dies after being impaled by sharp-billed fish
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Italian surfer Giulia Manfrini was surfing in the Mentawai Islands when she was impaled by a swordfish, Indonesian authorities said. The resort said it was a needlefish.

item.title: Buildings destroyed as Israel continues to hit Beirut with airstrikes
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Lior Soroka

item.title: Democrats and Republicans court overseas voters in tight election
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Democrats and Republicans are urging U.S. citizens in far-flung areas — from Toronto to Tel Aviv — to cast absentee ballots.

item.title: Sword with pharaoh’s mark found in Egypt, still shimmering 3,000 years later
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.

item.title: American views of China hit record low, poll finds, as animosity grows
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop
item.description: A majority of Americans — 55 percent — say the United States should actively work to limit the growth of China’s power, according to a Chicago Council poll.

item.title: Al Jazeera condemns Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Hazem Balousha

item.title: Israeli attacks on Hezbollah financing show group’s reach in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Blinken says ‘more progress’ from Israel needed on Gaza aid flow
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Claire Parker, Vivian Ho, John Hudson, Leo Sands, Missy Ryan, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting the Middle East. Israeli forces said they killed Hashem Safieddine, a top Hezbollah leader.

item.title: North Korean troops are in Russia, would be ‘legitimate targets’ in Ukraine, U.S. says
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe, Missy Ryan, Michelle Lee
item.description: The Biden administration said that at least 3,000 North Korean troops are training in Russia, though it remains unclear if they’ll join the war.

item.title: Israeli attacks on Hezbollah financing show group’s reach in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: Al-Qard al-Hasan became an integral part of the financial fabric of Lebanon, first offering microloans to Hezbollah’s support base and then expanding services.

item.title: Turkey says ‘terrorist attack’ on aerospace company leaves at least 5 dead, 22 injured
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Bryan Pietsch, Beril Eski, Sammy Westfall
item.description: No group immediately claimed responsibility. Turkey’s interior minister said it was “most likely carried out” by the Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or PKK.

item.title: American creating deepfakes targeting Harris works with Russian intel, documents show
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton
item.description: Russian documents reviewed by The Post expose the workings of a Moscow network that has become a potent source of fake news targeting American voters.

item.title: Northern Gaza conditions ‘beyond catastrophic,’ U.N. official says
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker

item.title: Putin relishes role on stage, but Ukraine war looms over BRICS summit
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: The summit’s final document said little about the Ukraine war, but several participants were still searching for a way to end it diplomatically.

item.title: Hezbollah confirms death of official seen as Nasrallah successor
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta

item.title: Israel strikes southern Lebanon and Beirut suburbs
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Vivian Ho

item.title: Hostage families say Blinken meeting left them uncertain of cease-fire talks
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, John Hudson

item.title: 19-year-old Walmart employee found dead inside walk-in oven
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho
item.description: Police in eastern Canada said the woman was discovered inside the store’s bakery department oven. The cause and manner of death are under investigation.

item.title: U.K.’s Labour denies Trump campaign’s election interference claim
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer dismissed the claim that members of his party were making “illegal foreign national contributions” by volunteering for the Harris campaign.
